column4: I get You do not appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver. Please edit your X configuration file (just run nvidia-xconfig as root), and restart the X server.
I tried and restarted and still nothing
I just installed new drivers and sdk
how did you install the drivers?
I installed the toolkit then I went to tty to install drivers
so you used the self installing .run drivers from the nvidia site?
yea
you did try the drivers from the repos and the PPA's first?
How do I do that
the addational-drivers tool, (jockey-gtk) installs them from the repos.. thats how one normally installs them.
id have that .run program remove its drivers, and try the  jockey tool first
you run jockey-gtk and click... ;)
in the menus its called 'addational-drivers' i belive
you DONT have one of those dual-gpu optimus  setups do you?
no
first I need to unistall current drivers? can I do that over ssh
i dont use the .run drivers. I think they do have some uninstall option. You might not need to remove them.. but its a good idea
I tried running jockey but it error out
if you are ssh'd in -  you could use the jockey-text tool.
Downloading package indexes failed, note I am on 10.04
or just try installing the nvidia-current package.
any idea on CUDA error: CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime version?
no clue. i dont use cuda.  the extendt of me using nvidia drivers - is i do a clean install.. run the jockey tool and install them from the repos.. done.
